Interface_name: Http based on libcurl in C++
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a C++ class that implements HTTP client functionality using libcurl for making HTTP requests and handling responses, including JSON parsing capabilities.

Class Description: The CurlHttpClient class provides methods for performing HTTP GET requests and downloading web pages, with support for custom headers and request bodies. It includes JSON response handling and memory management for received data.

Attributes:
MemoryStruct: [struct] - A helper structure for storing received data in memory during curl operations
  - memory: [char*] - Pointer to the allocated memory buffer
  - size: [size_t] - Size of the allocated memory buffer

Methods:
WriteMemoryCallback: [static](void* contents, size_t size, size_t nmemb, void* userp) -> size_t - A static callback function for libcurl to write received data into memory
  - contents: [void*] - Pointer to the received data
  - size: [size_t] - Size of each data element
  - nmemb: [size_t] - Number of data elements
  - userp: [void*] - Pointer to user-provided memory structure
  - Returns: The number of bytes actually written

downloadPage: [](const std::string& url, std::string& res, const std::vector<std::string>& headers, const std::string& body) -> long - Downloads a web page and returns the HTTP status code
  - url: [const std::string&] - The URL to request
  - res: [std::string&] - Reference to store the response body
  - headers: [const std::vector<std::string>&] - Vector of header strings to include in the request
  - body: [const std::string&] - Request body content
  - Returns: HTTP status code of the response

getRequest: [](const std::string& url, json& res, const std::vector<std::string>& headers, const std::string& body) -> long - Performs a GET request and parses the JSON response
  - url: [const std::string&] - The URL to request
  - res: [json&] - Reference to store the parsed JSON response
  - headers: [const std::vector<std::string>&] - Vector of header strings to include in the request
  - body: [const std::string&] - Request body content
  - Returns: HTTP status code of the response
